Thanks for your comment !

Optical flow sample

The issue is simply that it would be almost free to do implicitely something like

ix = ((ix + 1) / 2) * (IW-1) + w*IW/W;
iy = ((iy + 1) / 2) * (IH-1) + h*IH/H;

instead of https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/THNN/generic/SpatialGridSamplerBilinear.c#L71

constructing a new variable, whether it is from affine_grid or from a concatenation of two expanded torch.linspace or torch.arange seems OP for this very particular and yet common operation.

body:
Thanks for your comment !

## Optical flow sample
The issue is simply that it would be almost free to do implicitely something like
```
ix = ((ix + 1) / 2) * (IW-1) + w*IW/W;
iy = ((iy + 1) / 2) * (IH-1) + h*IH/H;
```
instead of https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/THNN/generic/SpatialGridSamplerBilinear.c#L71

constructing a new variable, whether it is from `affine_grid` or from a concatenation of two expanded `torch.linspace` or `torch.arange` seems OP for this very particular and yet common operation.
